title: Font used in Rogers of Canada logo
content:
I'm trying to figure out if the Rogers logo uses a public font or custom designed one that isn't for sale. Do ya'll know if it's a commercially available or free font?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [rogersfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009103031/http:/typophile.com/files/rogersfont.jpg) | 38.84 KB |
author: johnnyfont

comments.content:
It's possibly a customised version of Stone Sans, there's a lot of character similarities, but the 'R' makes me think it could still be a font I can't quite place!

Have a look tho…  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009103031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/stone-sans/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009103031im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grab_3492.jpg)

Should be [Marriott Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009103031/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/case/304329), Marriott Hotels & Resorts [exclusive typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009103031/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/case/16926).  
Other alternatives: [Ocean Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009103031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/ocean-sans-mt) (Extended Bold comes very close), [Cronos](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009103031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/cronos) (Display Bold)
